titleStmt.title: An elegie on the death of the Right Honourable Robert Blake, Esq. One of the generals at sea, who departed the 7. of August 1657. on board the George near Plymouth Sound.
titleStmt.author: Harrison, George, gent.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for John Bartlet the elder at the Golden Cup in Pauls Church-yard over against the Drapers, and John Bartlet the younger in Westminster Hall,

notesStmt.note: Verse - "VVhat means this silence sirs? what's here becom?".
Signed and dated at end: Geo: Harrison. Gent. On board the Dunbar in the Downs, Aug. 11. 1657.
L Copy stained with loss of text.
Reproduction of the originals in the British Library.

place.placeName: the Golden Cup in Pauls Church-yard over against the Drapers
